snippet: Stephan Templ, accused of defrauding the state by omitting a relative from a restitution claim for property looted by the Nazis in 1939, was sentenced to one year in prison.
lead_paragraph: Stephan Templ, accused of defrauding the state by omitting a relative from a restitution claim for property looted by the Nazis in 1939, was sentenced to one year in prison.

headline.main: Austrian Journalist Convicted in Holocaust Restitution Case Vows to Appeal
